note.p: Education: Trinity College, Cambridge; Gray's Inn. BA (1788), MA (1792)

Career: Called to the Bar (1794); practised in the Chancery Court; Commissioner for auditing the public accounts (1806-1835); retired on a pension; Director of the African Institute; edited the journals of Mungo Park; Senior Bencher of the Honorable Society of Grays Inn (at the time of his death)
References: Donald McDonald, 'Smithson Tennant, FRS (1761-1815)' in NR 1962 vol 17 pp 77-94
